content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

Hitch a ride with us through WordPress 4.7 and Genesis, a double helping of OfficeHours.fm, and a few photos from the Genesis Meetup at WordCamp US 2016.

WordPress 4.7 and Genesis

WordPress 4.7 was released this week, but before you go running to update make sure you’ve updated to the latest version of Genesis (or at least v2.4.0).

PSA: #genesiswp users, you need to be on at least Genesis 2.4.0 (released 9/28) for WordPress 4.7, which is scheduled for 12/6.

— Robin Cornett (@robincornett) December 5, 2016

Showcase

Jon Barratt for mazzone.com.au

New #genesiswp site for Andrew Mazzone Design Jeweller (just in time for Christmas shopping!) – https://t.co/FxnS7nARXD

— Jon Barratt (@KrolynStudios) December 9, 2016

ChillyBin Web Design with two new sites, a soft launch of thewishlane.com

We soft-launched this #genesiswp site last Friday, a vendor marketplace running #wcvendors and #woocommerce pic.twitter.com/oPXEAssUcs

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) December 8, 2016

…and a redesigned site for themedicalconcierge.com.sg

We've just launched a redesigned #genesiswp site for The Medical Concierge Group in Singapore | https://t.co/fFyd77w8CV pic.twitter.com/d7Ym6gpsvf

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) December 7, 2016

Going Awesome Places launched their new website on Genesis, goingawesomeplaces.com

Brand new website design thanks to #genesisWP and @studiopress https://t.co/vQDCuo4G0q #newandimproved

— Will Tang (@GoAwesomePlaces) December 6, 2016

Podcasts

No StudioPress.fm or Rethink.fm this week, but there’s a double bill of OfficeHours.fm action, first up Carrie chats to Chris Coyier (Mr CSS Tricks)…

Episode 122 with @chriscoyier now available! https://t.co/8piqhao6gc pic.twitter.com/DdLfUCOOTA

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) December 5, 2016

…and you catch the replay of After Office Hours – holiday edition – when Carrie chats to Diane Kinney, Joe Casabona and Ozzy Rodriguez.

We’re LIVE tonight at 8pET! https://t.co/Dx0rzzvwZ0 #officefm pic.twitter.com/TQSLk4IuiY

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) December 8, 2016

Best of the rest

The Genesis community’s Jackie D’Elia shares her story on HeroPress this week.

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, #GenesisWP community member @jdelia featured on @heropress https://t.co/JCZjxyvQ4W

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) December 7, 2016

Sridhar Katakam has been rolling out the free tutorials this week, including 3 Methods to Add a Title for Footer Widgets in Genesis…

3 Methods to Add a Title for Footer Widgets in Genesis:https://t.co/0lR11ZcrmF#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/7FJL2CarpO

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) December 5, 2016

…and how to apply a full content layout to archives in Genesis

How to apply Full Content layout to archives in Genesis:https://t.co/RVILACCxqs#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/NWnbIuanTb

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) December 5, 2016

Neil Gee on how to create a multiple marker map from an Advanced Custom Field Google Map Location Field in a custom post type in Genesis.

Create Multiple Marker Map from ACF Google Map Location Field from a CPT on #GenesisWP https://t.co/s80dRYSgZv

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) December 11, 2016

…and fixing the BuddyPress profile page CSS on a Genesis theme.

Fixing #BuddyPress Profile Page CSS on a #GenesisWP Theme https://t.co/SnB3vJHvj4

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) December 4, 2016

Matt Smith shared a list of 25 free Genesis child themes.

25+ Best Free Genesis Child Themes (100% Free To Download)

And finally…

Big up to all the Genesis peeps that rocked WordCamp US last weekend, hope you had a blast!

A very well-attended #genesiswp Meetup! #wcus pic.twitter.com/vNS84XX8zp

— carrie dils (@cdils) December 3, 2016

The #GenesisWP crowd at #wcus pic.twitter.com/OX9EdccWda

— Mike Hale (@MikeHale) December 5, 2015

#wcus #genesiswp meetup @ hard rock philly. pic.twitter.com/lDKHK5IJKD

— Alex (@alx2k5) December 4, 2015

—

That’s all for this week.

I’ll be back with the probably the last edition of This Week in Genesis before Christmas (and for this year) next week.

So, if you’ve got something you want to share with the Genesis community make sure to submit it at genesiswp.guide/add and I’ll be pick the best to share with you all next week.

Till then, have a great week and let’s keep Genesis awesome.

PS Love these updates so much you can’t stand to miss one? Go subscribe below and never miss out again!

excerpt.rendered: WordPress 4.7 and Genesis, a double helping of OfficeHours.fm, and a few photos from the Genesis Meetup at WordCamp US 2016
